metadata.title: CVE-2018-12122 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Node.js: All versions prior to Node.js 6.15.0, 8.14.0, 10.14.0 and 11.3.0:Slowloris HTTP Denial of Service: An attacker can cause a Denial of Service(DoS) by sending headers very slowly keeping HTTP or HTTPS connections andassociated resources alive for a long period of time.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12122` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnode64 - 10.15.1~dfsg-5
nodejs - 10.15.1~dfsg-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nodejs package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.15.1~dfsg-5').
